physDesc.additional: Script: dpe tshugs. Folio numbered with letters (only ga, cha and ja are visible). Lines per folio; 11; 10 on fol. 6b; 8 on fol. 7a. Orthography: - Abbreviations (e.g., for slob dpon, thams cad, final –gs, etc.) - Bindu for m - Numerals used for numbers and for phonetic value (e.g., 4+n for bzhin) - Frequent broken shad ( ¦ ), sometimes used in place of tsheg. - Alternative prefixes (e.g., rngos for dngos) - la rtsogs pa for la sogs pa - ṇa (reversed form of na) for med - Tibetan numerals used for numbers (e.g. 2 po for gnyis po) - gzhan written with "n" below the leg of "zh". Several annotations (corrections as well as glosses). A da-drag is used in an annotation on fol. 4b8 ('phrind).

lg.l: dge ba 'di yis tsha rabs kun tu bdag ||
byang chub sems dang mthu yis dpa' rnams kyi ||
zab yangs ngo mtshar rmad kyi spyod pa la ||
mi 'jigs brtson 'grus seng ge'i stobs ldan shog || ||

ab.note: Thanks to the virtue [of composing] this [commentary], in all [my future] lives, may I have fearlessness, diligence, and the lion’s strength {Alternatively: may I have the strength of a fearless diligent lion}, towards profound, extensive, wonderful, and marvelous practice of heroes, by means of the mind and the power of Bodhi.
